_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX XXXX XXXX Date To : Macys XXXX Inc XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, NY XXXX Attn : XXXX XXXX Executive Office Dear XXXX XXXX, My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am writing to address the ongoing issues with my Macys credit account ( Account Number : XXXX ). Despite multiple attempts to resolve these matters over the phone, I have not received the necessary assistance to correct the inaccuracies on my account. 

XXXX. Disputed Charge and Lack of Support : I have called Macys customer service many times to dispute a charge of {$31.00} and address other concerns. Each time, the representatives were either unwilling or unable to assist me effectively. Macys should have records of these calls to verify my repeated efforts. 
XXXX. Late Fee : I acknowledge the late fee of {$31.00} charged on XX/XX/year>, and its subsequent credit on XX/XX/year>. However, this does not resolve the main issue of incorrect reporting. 
XXXX Credit Reporting Inaccuracy : My account was reported as 30 days delinquent in XX/XX/year>. I have consistently disputed this information, stating that payments for XXXX and XX/XX/year> were made but not properly applied to my account. 

Additional Impact : Due to this delinquency on my credit report, my auto insurance increased to {$330.00} per month. This has been a significant financial burden. 

I request that Macys conduct a comprehensive review, including the phone call records, and correct the inaccuracies on my account. Additionally, I request the removal of the disputed by consumer note from my credit report once the issue is resolved. 

Additionally, I do not want any Macys advertisements sent to my apartment. 

I hope to resolve this matter amicably and promptly. Thank you for your attention to this important issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Made payments and they still asked for more interest fees. Last call they stated that they had closed my account without my request. My XXXX XXXX has dropped. _source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I booked a trip on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, but right after I paid, I realized that Ive put the wrong dates by mistake I was very worried because I did see the non-refundable policy from this property on the detail page. And I also checked the correct dates were actually not available to book, so there was no way to ask for a modification of my booking. Since it was midnight and no XXXX customer agents were available at that time, I only had to contact XXXX  credit card customer service to ask if there was anything they could do to help me with this case. 

The agent on the call, the agent assured me that in this case, I could wait a few days for the pending charge to be posted, and cancel the service and submit a dispute, and eventually get money back with XXXX help. I was hopeful from what the agent told me, so I did what she told me to do, saw the pending charge posted on XX/XX/XXXX, canceled the stay with XXXX the same day, tried to work with them to get the dates modified or get the full refund but all failed. So I submitted a dispute, hoping to get my money back through my bank. After waiting for a few months, I got a rejection from XXXX for my dispute. I called XXXX customer service again to explain what happened and what the previous agent promised me. The new agent asked me to re-open the dispute by submitting supporting documents, which I did what she said. The case was re-opened but I was not being contacted or notified for the final results. I have been tracking the dispute process on my app though for a few months, and no updates until recently, the case was closed quietly. No notification, no contact from the bank, it secretly closed. And of course, I did not get my money back or even get an explanation. 

Since I did not actually stay at the property, I believe they did not have any losses due to this however, I lost {$XXXX} for nothing. XXXX it was caused by my own mistake in the first place, but I acted very quickly to try to correct the mistake, although the policy was too strict for me to do so. Moreover, what the first agent told me made me feel confident to get my money back with XXXX help, which turned out to be not, which is very frustrating : (. And the fact that no communication afterward is also frustrating. I hope XXXX  can help me get my money back as I indeed did not use the service at all. 

Also I was unfortunately impacted by a mass layoff in XX/XX/XXXX, and not yet found a job due to the harsh market. {$XXXX} bucks would really mean a lot to me at this challenging time. I sincerely appreciate it.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement

_source.complaint_what_happened:
In XX/XX/XXXX I was notified by an identity protection provider that several credit cards were opened or attempted to be opened in my name. 
On or about XX/XX/XXXX, I was contacted by XXXX police department that my personal information including my Social security number, a credit card statement and other personal information was obtained during a search of a residence in XXXX  XXXX. I filed a police report with the XXXX Police Department on XX/XX/XXXX. Police report # XXXX. I reported there were 11-12 attempts to open credit cards in mine and/or my wife 's name. 
XX/XX/XXXX I faxed all of the information to Barclay 's for the first time. 
That information included the XXXX policy report # XXXX. 
On or around XX/XX/XXXX, I received a restitution letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX, District Attorney, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, State of Oklahoma that I was a victim of a crime. Case # XXXX State of Oklahoma XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I filled out the Itemized restitution request letter informing them that a XXXX rewards credit card issued by Barclay 's Bank had been taken out and purchases in the amount of {$980.00} were made on the card. 
The card in question I later received the credit card at my residence. 
I contacted Barclay 's bank with the assistance of XXXX from my XXXX XXXX XXXX and informed Barclay 's the card was taken out fraudulently and I wanted it investigated. The card was placed on suspension and was investigated. I received a letter from Barclay 's that after investigation, they concluded the card was not taken out fraudulently. 
I have sent Barclay 's the police report 3 times. Two times via fax and 1 time regular mail. A copy of the restitution letter from the District Attorney and have called Barclay 's approximately 25 times explained the situation and every time it's the same response. 
I'm told it will be investigated and in a few days I received a letter explaining that they have concluded their investigation and no fraudulent activity found. 
The entire ordeal included approximately 17credit cards being taken out or trying to be taken out in mine or my wife name and SSN.

Barclay 's is the only card remaining that has not recognized the illegal activity in my name

_source.complaint_what_happened:
As per my American Express credit card statement with Closing Date XX/XX/XXXX, I had to pay a minimum of {$40.00} by XXXX XXXX. On XXXX XXXX, I submitted a payment from my bank. Unfortunately, the bank did not process the payment until XXXX XXXX. Nonetheless, I have been informed in the past by support staff at American Express that they go by the date that the payment was submitted and so in theory I should not have had to pay any late fee. 

However, as per the Statement with a Closing Date XX/XX/XXXX, I received notice that I am supposed to pay a Late Payment Fee of {$29.00} plus Interest Charge on Pay Over Time Purchases of {$2.00}. This is for an outstanding amount of only {$82.00}. This is altogether a fee of 38.5 %. 

This would seem to clearly go against the rule of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau that limits such payments to {$8.00} per month [ SEE CFPB Bans Excessive Credit Card Late Fees, Lowers Typical Fee from {$32.00} to {$8.00} announced on XX/XX/XXXX. Accessed XXXX XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX : XXXX ] I called American Express Customer Service XXXX XXXX XXXX and spoke to an agent. I questioned the charges and I specifically invoked the CPFB rule. Even after the agent spoke with his supervisor, there was no movement on the side of American Express. I informed them that I would be forced to submit a complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and would probably terminate my account with American Express as a result of this treatment but this made no difference at all.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.sub_issue: Problem with fees

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I opened a secured credit card with my own money. The amount deposited was {$1000.00} which I was told would be my credit limit. Upon entering into the agreement, I inquired about the secure card being transitioned into a revolving account. I was advised as well as it was outlined in terms and agreements that once I maintained a positive payment history for a year my account would automatically transition into a revolving account. I maintained my account in great standing for over the time period allowed, how the agents kept creating unfounded claims and stipulations to push back the maturity date. Never upholding the bank policy and procedures. I was advised by Citibank credit department that my account did actually qualify. My account was never transitioned. 

In addition to failing to adhere to secured card policies, claims were not properly adjudicated and Citibank blocked my access to account to view transactions, prevented me from filing a claim and closed my account without cause or notification. 

Citibank then erroneously reported my account to the credit bureaus as a late payment account and charged off account. This is not the case. Also, the funds were my own. Citibank reported my account as a revolving account, However, I was advised by Citibank card services that this was never transferred to a revolving account. I secure card account was never in default. Citibank reported my account was charged off owing {$450.00} of the {$1000.00}. There was no possible way this is owed because the limit was only {$1000.00} and the account will not allow for transactions to process over the {$1000.00} Citibank is reporting my account fraudulently and legal action will be taken if this is not corrected with ALL credit reporting agencies.

I then attempted to remain in honor by tendering payment for {$130.00} via an Ambiguous Negotiable Instrument in the form of a paid U.S. Postal Money Order ; which clearly states at the bottom that it is a negotiable instrument which I bought and paid for the rights to negotiate it. Postal Money Order Serial Number 's XXXX and XXXX was made with the proper clauses and provision based on banking law in the amount of {$130.00} in accordance with HJR-192 ( The XXXX XXXX Act/Emergency Banking Act ), Public Law 72-10, U.C.C 3-603 ( b ), U.C.C . 3-311 and Public Law for Negotiable Instruments to Continental Finance ( XXXX ) on XX/XX/year>. 
They dishonored my instrument and did not credit my account correctly. Instead, they refused to stand in honor of the law by applying proper payment. They credited the account 's for {$45.00} each instead of the tendered negotiable amount of {$130.00}. Even with the agreeing that they do accept legal tender, which is what I provided ; and even with the ability for the instrument to remain negotiable which is an even greater benefit for them. 
I am filing a complaint and asking for an immediate investigation to rectify the situation without levy so they may remain in honor. As it stands, they are committing an illegal act and are currently in dishonor, as their practices are against the laws in which our country is built on.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Aspire Financial for furnishing information to credit reporting agencies without my consent. I believe this action is in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ). 

Recently, I discovered that Aspire Financial has furnished my personal and financial information to the credit reporting agencies without obtaining my consent. This unauthorized sharing of information has negatively impacted my credit report and privacy. 

Relevant Law : 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) - " Opt-out '' Requirements : This section of the FCRA requires financial institutions to provide customers with an opportunity to opt out of the sharing of their information with non-affiliated third parties. Aspire Financial did not provide me with this opportunity, nor did I give any consent for my information to be shared. 

Aspire Financial has shared my personal and financial information with credit reporting agencies without my explicit consent, violating 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ). 

Lack of XXXX XXXX : I was not given the required opportunity to opt out of having my information shared with non-affiliated third parties. Additionally, I never received my forms to opt out. This opportunity should have been clear and conspicuous, and it was not. Signing a contract that states the company " may '' report does not suffice under this law. 

I request that Aspire Financial cease the unauthorized sharing of my information immediately and take corrective actions to rectify the negative impact on my credit report. I also request written confirmation that my complaint has been received and is being addressed. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.company_public_response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law
_source.sub_issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I was forced by my old job to sign up for a synchrony bank Sam 's credit card because of synchrony banks predatory policy regarding how many credit cards they can get people to sign up for. If you didn't get any signups they would penalize the company and the company would penalize your club and your managers would penalize the employees for not trying hard enough for not making quota on credits. This would force our managers to try and " encourage '' employees to sign up for one to show corporate that we were at least trying. At first it was alright I kept the balance low and paid it off on time. Then the inflation crisis hit and I was having to use it to put gas in my car at {$5.00} a gallon to get to work. Well that quickly ballooned the balance up to {$2000.00} dollars. I had a {$5000.00} limit. I was paying the minimum amount per month with no issues. 
Fast forward to XXXX of 2024 and my credit score plumits from XXXX down to XXXX and my minimum payment goes from {$98.00} to {$250.00} dollars and my credit limit is decreased by {$2000.00} dollars with no warning, no letter, no email, no call, NOTHING!! Now I'm inundated with harassing collection calls from synchrony demanding the full minimum payment. And when I pay what I can they informed me that what I pay will go towards the previous month and not the current month.
_source.sub_product: Store credit card
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am XXXX XXXX. My father ( XXXX XXXX ) and mother ( XXXX XXXX ) have had a CitiAdvantage Gold Card account with Citibank, NA since XX/XX/XXXX. My father passed away on XX/XX/XXXX. Of course, XXXX XXXX has continued to use the account under the assumption that it was a joint account. Yet, when Citi kept sending cards in her deceased husband 's name, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) called the Citi number to ask them to stop sending cards in his name. She had no intention to close the account. When her call was routed to Citi 's overseas call center, the agent confused her by rushing to close the account. This is when we learned that it was not a " joint account '', but rather XXXX was the account holder and XXXX an additional cardholder. 

So, Citi 's agent closes the account immediately and this causes all credit card statements and online access to their account to stop too. XXXX XXXX asks what is owed so she can send a check, which she did to pay off the account. Unbeknownst to widow XXXX, Citi had caused a {$1.00} cent charge to be assessed to the closed account for interest. As if that was not unscrupulous enough, Citi then tacked on a {$30.00} late fee on the account and sent it to XXXX XXXX XXXX to collect on a {$31.00} amount that it generated after closing the account and while they left all of the cardholder 's relatives in the dark as to anything related to the account. 

In an attempt to alleviate XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX about her account being closed ( and prior to Citi 's XX/XX/XXXX surprise collection letter ), I called Citi to request online access or paper copies of statements so that XXXX XXXX would have them for her records and tax purposes. After being bounced around from the offshore agents to different departments at Citi ( forced to re-verify the account information, SSNs, etc. each time I was transferred ), I landed at the Citi Probate Dept where I was advised that the account was closed with nothing outstanding, so XXXX would have to fax a request for statements along with more proof of identity within the written requests. We did so immediately. 

Several weeks after sending the faxed request, widow XXXX received in the mail the requested statements a cover letter addressed to now-deceased Dad XXXX XXXX XXXX Citibank NA dated XX/XX/XXXX, in which it claim astonishingly claimed that Citi was owed an outstanding debt of {$31.00}. When I checked the statements that were never sent to the family of XXXX XXXX or viewable online due to the account closure, I discovered that Citibank had snuck this de minimis interest charge of {$1.00} to the account and then ballooned it by over XXXX to make it this contrived and eggregious {$31.00} debt. 

Obviously and predictably, the Citibank Probate/Estate Department knowingly and with utter disregard sent this reasonably requested packet of recent account statements with a COLLECTION LETTER to the widow, causing her panic and fear and even tears. As her son and being a transactional lawyer, I felt like this should be easy to resolve with a call to Citi. Since doing so last Friday, I have been bounced around from Citi 's overseas agents to their US agents, from one department to another ( Estates Team, Internal Probate, and other names used ), and eventually to someone that appears to have been with XXXX The lengthy ( hour-plus ) effort to navigate Citi 's labyrinth looking for someone at Citi to do the responsible thing and zero out the account while reversing the collection orders all led me to be transferred a man at XXXX XXXX ( ID XXXX ), who was rude throughout. Though I had verified the account and the private information about my father to establish who I was and that I was in fact speaking on behalf of the estate for my father 's account, he asked for even more by insisting upon knowing the date of death of my father. i do not retain that so I immediately searched for it. After a minute of looking while strongly suggesting that he in the meantime work on closing the collection effort so we did not waste everyone 's time exposing Citi 's misconduct more publicly, he got angry and then stated " you have exceeded the allotted time to verify the account '' - notwithstanding the fact that I had given him the SSN, card/account number with security code/DOB, etc. Conveniently for him, he terminated the call a couple of minutes before XXXX pm when their offices closed for the weekend. So, I was not able to get anyone at Citi or XXXX on the phone until this week. 

Upon calling today to the XXXX number that Citi had given me ( XXXX ), a nice agent " Precious '' was not finding the account by any of XXXX XXXX 's personally identifying information or the account number. After much time looking, the signal dropped and the call disconnected. So, I called back and got another nice person, who too could not find the account. So, I called the Citi Estates Team number and got a woman named XXXX. She could not do anything on the account and suggested I contact XXXX, so I reiterated that I had called them on the number I got from Citi, and had been transferred to them directly from Citi. Plus, when I called the number on the XX/XX/XXXX collection letter from Citi, it had a fax dial tone ( multiple attempts made ). So, this person transferred me again to the " Probate Specialist '' at XXXX who again was not able to find anything with my father XXXX 's Citibank account information. 

Because I have now wasted hours of time and endured the pain of many days of anxiety by my beautiful mother, I am just redirecting my time into this complaint, which I will also attach to a letter to Citi to put them on notice of their harrasment, abusive debt collection practices, shady interest/late fees on this closed account of a deceased cardholder without regard for the widow and family dealing with Citibank 's abuses. Citibank should immediately remove the charges its processes affixed to a deceased account holder 's ledger after telling the family that the account was closed with no amounts owing, plus what I suggest below.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
_source.sub_issue: Company closed your account

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/2024, I received a message from Citi regarding a potential fraudulent charge. The charge was for charging an electric vehicle some place outside of XXXX where I live. I do not own an EV nor has there ever been an EV charge on my account. I have plenty of gas station charges, however. I immediately called and confirmed that this was in fact a fraudulent charge. I closed the account, and they reissued another card and account number. 

Fast forward, they reversed the credit they issued. I called on XX/XX/XXXX when I noticed this. They told me that the merchant sent in a receipt for the charge. The receipt is nothing more than a receipt. No signature. It is not sufficient evidence ( I am an XXXX ) to support I was there and made the charge. On the call, I explained that a receipt does not mean I made the purchase. They agreed and were supposed to give me credit. 

I just received my statement yesterday on XX/XX/XXXX. The credit has been reversed again! I talked with a few people at Citi yesterday and was told that because I did not respond to a letter they sent by XX/XX/XXXX, it was my fault. I called them on XX/XX/XXXX which they have noted in the system. I explained again that this charge should never have been on my account since they knew it was fraudulent even before I did. I called immediately to confirm it was fraudulent. They are now saying they will resubmit the credit again and it will take XXXX  days to receive. This is outrageous! I have spent XXXX hours on this already, and they are hoping to wear me down or I will forget. This is not ethical in any way. 

PLEASE investigate Citi. I feel certain this is probably more widespread than me given the reponses from employees. THis is not a mistake. This is their practice now. You could ask for all their fraudulent transaction flags, the list of customers that called to confirm the charges were fraudulent, and then see that they continued to charge the customer hoping they would not notice. ( I am an XXXX. ) They are scamming consumers!!! And it's not right. I have never had an issue like this with a fraudulent charge. Typically, if the company knows it is fraudulent, the charge never hits the account. Also, please encourage consumers to check their statements very carefully.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I used my Chase Freedom card with XXXX to make an in-app purchase on my phone. At no point was I warned that the purchase would be considered a XXXX XXXX if I used my Chase card. At no point did these fees appear in my XXXX transactions. I continued to use this method of purchase for small transactions multiple times with no correspondence from Chase notifying me of this unusual behavior causing my account to rack up with {$10.00} fees per transaction. 

I called and explained the situation to customer service. I am a long-time Chase customer and have never had any issues with delinquency or anything on my account. I notified the agent that I would not have used my Chase card had I known about these fees. And I certainly would not have continued to use the card consecutively across a handful of days knowing I was being charged this fee. 

In total, I was charged {$10.00} on XXXX separate occasions resulting in {$80.00} in fees on just over {$500.00} in charges. The representative advised that he would be reversing all XXXX fees and the {$80.00} in total. I thanked him for understanding and then he hung up on me without offering to answer any other questions. I received XXXX fee reversal of {$10.00} and no further correspondence about his inability to reverse the remaining {$70.00} worth of fees. I called back to check status of said reversals and a different representative advised that they were declined. When I asked him to escalate since I was informed he could not get the fees reversed he said nothing was possible, he has full decision making authority on this request. I advised that I will no longer be using this Chase account he said he understood and that there is nothing he can do. A shameful example of customer service for a cardholder in good standing for over XXXX  years.

_source.complaint_what_happened: On XX/XX/2024, I made a payment of {$2000.00} to my XXXX credit card with Wells Fargo theough WF 's portal. Typically, the funds are immediately available and so that is what I expected. However, when the funds were showing as unavailable, I called the number on the back of my XXXX card and I was told the funds would be available the next day, which was also my final day to pay my rent without a late fee being accessed. The next day the funds were still not available so I called again and I was told that there was a hold on the payment and the matter was escalated. The next person told me that they would send an email to the appropriate department requesting the hold be removed and I would get an email on the decision within a few hours. After about 6 or 7 hours, I had received nothing so I called back in and asked to speak to someone in that same escalated department. The gentleman was very rude and he told me that WF should not even be handling my call and they were doing me a favor by taking my call and I actually needed to be calling XXXX directly. I explained that I called the number on the back of my card and he then gave me another number which ultimately brought me back to WF again. At this point, I spoke with a supervisor that explained to me that a possible reason for the hold was a returned payment. In XXXX, I was transitioning to another bank account and I accidentally chose the wrong account to make my payment from. Once I realized the mistake, I immediately corrected it. Once she told me that, I was more understanding of them wanting to verify the funds but I never recieved an email requesting the verification so I ended uo with a late fee being added to XXXX 's rent. The funds would become available 4 days after my initial payment. On XX/XX/XXXX, I made another payment through the WF portal for {$1000.00}. As of XX/XX/XXXX, the funds are still unavailable and I am now being told there is a 15 day hold on the payment. I was told that if I opened a WF checking or savings account there would be no hold but since I'm paying from an outside bank there is a hold. Even when I went into a WF branch and made a payment to the card using cash, the funds were still not available until the next day. I declined to open an account and reached out to their executive team as suggested by their customer service rep. I was then told it could take up to 30 days for someone to get back to me, and I still have no explanation how the hold went from 4 days the first time and now to 15 days.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I applied for a XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX card in store today XX/XX/year>. The rep helping me advised the card was approved with a {$3500.00} limit and I was attempting to use it for a new purchase. The transaction was declined three times. The rep called in and was only advised that I had to wait for the physical card, entirely defeating the purpose of applying. I completed the purchase with another card and proceeded to call the customer service line at XXXX. The first customer rep I spoke with reached out to another department and could only tell me a security block was placed. At that time I requested a supervisor. The supervisor whose name I believe was XXXX proceeded to give very vague and misleading answers. At first I was told there was multiple systems that the application had to scan through, then told XXXX XXXX systems. He kept stating that he had no information on why the block was placed, then proceeded to tell me it was flagged as fraud. After addressing the lie he told stating he didnt know anything then telling me it was fraud, the rep kept interrupting me and eventually chose to hang up after I said it was XXXX me the XXXXXXXX XXXX that he wouldnt let me finish speaking. 
After this interaction I called back in and requested another supervisor. I cant recall the name of the second supervisor but she was more helpful and transferred me to a different department, I believe it was their consumer protection department. This rep then gave very vague answers saying for security reasons I couldnt be verified. I asked for clarification on what couldnt be verified but I was denied any explanation. I was continually told I would be contacted. I then asked how I would be contacted and was told it could be either phone, email, or regular mail. When I asked for clarification on when I should expect a follow up I was told it could take up to a month. I then asked what would happen if I hadnt heard anything within a month and was told Id need to call back in. I asked what would happen at that point given Ive been told I cant be helped over the phone and wasnt given an answer. 

At this point I requested to cancel the card due to the lack of information provided and the overall frustration of the experience. I was denied my request to cancel stating I had to wait for the verification before I could even cancel. 

At this point with no guarantees of any sort of resolution from the company Im resulting to filing this complaint. I was provided with a receipt from the physical store that my application was instantly approved for a {$3500.00} limit, told it could be used for the purchase I was there to make that day, and subsequently denied any explanation from the merchant as to what the issue with my account is despite providing my physical ID in person during the application.

XX/XX/year> ( XXXXXXXX XXXX ) - Phone call made to Citi Bank at XXXX. I say the payment hasn't processed on XXXX XXXX XXXX side. I ask to verify the credit card number used for the balance transfer. They inform me the balance transfer was verified and processed to an account ending in XXXX instead of the last four digits of my credit card ending in XXXX. They inform me the number was off by exactly one digit. I ask them to investigate and dispute the transaction so that it can be properly completed. They say they will call XXXX XXXX on my behalf. I receive claim XXXX XXXXXXXX and they say it will take up to 20 days to process the investigation. 

XX/XX/year>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) - Phone call made to XXXX XXXX at XXXX. XXXX XXXX informs me they have not received a balance transfer and that the credit card number ending in XXXX does not exist at their bank. I further research that the credit card number indeed violates the XXXX XXXX digit and that the credit card number verified by Citi Bank belongs to a credit card that physically does not exist. 

XX/XX/year> - Citi Bank sends mail acknowledging they are looking into the balance transfer XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - I call Citi Bank at XXXX and ask for update. They said they are still investigating the transaction and that it could take up to 20 days. They'll reach out if any more information is requested. 

XX/XX/year> ( XXXXXXXX XXXX ) - I awake to email from Citi Bank with a confirmation that the balance transfer was successfully sent. They provide me with a trace ID and write " if the payment hasn't been applied correctly, please provide the payee with the following details of the transaction ''. 

XX/XX/year> ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX - I call Citi Bank at XXXX to clarify the information with the Citi Bank representative. They tell me that the money has been sent to XXXX XXXX and to use this information to retrieve the funds and have them properly deposited in my XXXX XXXX credit card account ending in XXXX. 

XX/XX/year> ( XXXXXXXX XXXX  ) - I call XXXX XXXX at XXXX. They tell me that the trace ID can not be tracked in their system and that the two banks use different systems. Furthermore, the credit card team again looks up the credit card number ending in XXXX for the disputed transfer and reiterates this credit card number does not exist. They tell me there is no way the balance transfer could have been completed and that even if Citi Bank tried to process the balance transfer, the funds would have bounced and promptly been returned. They say to call Citi Bank back. 

XX/XX/year> ( XXXX am ) - I call Citi Bank back and inform them of XXXX XXXX 's perspective. That the credit card number off by XXXX digit does not exist in their system and there is no way it could have been processed as Citi Bank has described. They transfer me to XXXX and a new representative from their dispute department. This person said they will open up a new investigation. I tell them directly, " I am literally in the balance transfer portal on your website right now. Can you tell me how it is possible to enter a credit card number that does not exist and immediately receive verification that it does exist? '' She tells me, " I'm not sure why that is ''. They tell me to call XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX and give them permission to speak to Citi Bank directly ( two and half weeks ago, Citi said they would do this on their own ). I call XXXX XXXX, they say they can not talk to Citi Bank unless I am on the phone. I call Citi Bank to relay this information and am transferred to someone who says there is nothing they can do with this information and nothing else they can to do help. They say I will have to wait for the second investigation to conclude. 

In short, I am extremely confused that I can not enter an invalid credit number ( differing by one digit ) on Best Buy 's website to purchase a DVD but I can enter an invalid credit card number ( differing by one digit ) on Citi Bank 's website, have it verified, and have {$2800.00} sent to XXXX XXXX at an account number that XXXX XXXX  says does not exist. 

Now both banks are telling me to call the other bank and neither of them seem to be capable of doing anything. Citi says they have processed a transaction that XXXX XXXX says is impossible given the card number doesn't exist. 

Can anyone help me?

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I signed up a few years ago for an Amazon Credit Card, as I was a poor XXXX  XXXX  and wanted the {$50.00} gift card that came with it. Unbeknownst to me, Amazon went ahead and activated the card before it was delivered, and they automatically added the card as a default backup payment to my Amazon account. 

At some point, I purchased something and went about my day. Amazon, unlike ANY other retailer I have experience with, waits up to 3 hours to charge debit cards ( which is to my understanding not a part of any industry standard policy ). In the hours that had passed, I can only guess that my balance changed for my debit card, and I had insufficient funds. Amazon decides that if you authorize payment with one financial institution it also means you're authorizing payment on an Amazon Credit Card, a card that I never even activated and never set as a default payment.

As my Amazon account was through a XXXX  email, I at some point lost access to my account. This seems abusive and it feels like a corporation fishing for low-hanging and financially disadvantaged fruit, especially in the context of users being at checkout, seeing a checkbox saying " Get {$50.00} for free '', and not realizing it could cost them half a point on their credit score. 

In short : Amazon 's credit card and transaction authorization policies are unethical, and predatory, and lack a clear boundary of consensual payment when handling credit/debit cards from different financial institutions.

_source.complaint_what_happened: I am reaching out regarding my Aspire Credit card issued by the XXXX XXXX XXXX. Back at the end of XXXX my card was lost and I contacted Aspire customer service to report that my card was missing, to my surprise I realized that my card was not actually lost that it had been stolen because I had multiple fraudulent transactions, which they happily assisted me with. I received the provisional credit and subsequently received a letter asking me for additional to which I supplied the information requested by the bank. Its been exactly 89 days and my card was lost walking into the mall, I assume as I do not really know the details exactly how the card was lost other than I know my card was missing along with the inner part of my wallet and my id. Not only did they reverse the I ended up having to get a new ID as well. I notified the bank and everything seemed to be ok. I logged into my account this morning to see that my previously resolved case that was credited to my account for the fraud had been reversed and was told even previously told that it was found in my favor. I spoke with Customer Service and they told me and read me the notes from the investigation team that stated because I have another recent claim within 2 months, which it was not, they denied the first claim as well and Reversed it because they claim it could not be fraud. This is absolutely ridiculous. I asked previously if I should file a police report from back in XXXX and was told no, I was again told no on the second report but despite being told no, I didnt need it I actually did file a police report with my local police department, report XXXX was filed with the XXXX Police department for the most recent incident. How are they claiming this is not fraud. Most of these transactions were made during my working hours, and with companies I have never even done business with. They should not be holding me accountable for fraudulent charges, its not my fault their system did not catch these, especially considering I rarely use the card and charges just start coming in back to back on an account thats rarely used. This not acceptable. This was fraud and I did not participate or benefit from the transactions and did what I was supposed to do and notified the credit card company as soon as I learned about the fraud. Not only did the reverse the previously approved fraud they reversed valid fraud charges to the account and closed it!!

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I am writing to file a complaint against Bank of America because they made a arbitrary and unjustified decision to reduce my credit limit with no basis in fact for the change. I sent a letter to Bank of America on XX/XX/XXXX. asking them to restore my credit limit or provide additional information explaining the decision. Because of the potential for this change to have a substantially negative impact on my access to credit I am not willing to wait for Bank of America to respond. 

I received a letter dated XX/XX/year>, that lists three reasons that Bank of America elected to decrease my credit limit : Current or past delinquency on one or more of your accounts with us and/or our affiliates Recent trend in balance on one or more of your accounts, with us and our affiliates, compared to past balance Strength of payment on one or more of your accounts with us and/or our affiliates. 

As the letter advised, I immediately reviewed my credit report from XXXX XXXX. Based on the report as of XX/XX/year>, no evidence supports any reasons for reducing my credit limit. There is no indication of any late payments on the credit report, no irregular or rapid increase or decrease in my balance owed, and my payments have been consistent and automatic for many years. When my promotional rate on a portion of my balance recently expired, I ensured that my automated payments increased to cover the new minimums. 

The only recent change that occurred in my relationship with Bank of America or their affiliates was the expiration of my promotional balance transfer rate on a portion of my balance. The expiry is likely the real reason my credit limit decreased. There is no evidence on my credit report supporting the reasons given. As mentioned above, I needed to adjust my payments, and I did so before the XX/XX/XXXX due date, which was more than XXXX days after the date of the XX/XX/XXXX letter informing me of the decision to lower my credit limit. 

Because the decision to lower my credit limit will harm my ability to obtain credit and be used as a basis to either increase my interest rate or further decrease my credit limit. The justifications listed in the XX/XX/XXXX letter do not stand up to even the most cursory inspection of my credit report from XXXX XXXX or any of the other XXXX credit reporting agencies. 

This decision to reduce my credit limit is arbitrary and an attempt to manipulate my financial reputation. At worst, it is a cynical attempt to undo the promotional balance transfer rates Bank of America has previously offered. 

I have attached my most current credit reports and the letter I sent to Bank of America.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, NJ XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/year> Barclays Bank Delaware Credit Dispute Department XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX, DE XXXX Dear XXXX, Subject : Follow-Up on Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Report Information Underage Account Thank you for your response dated XX/XX/year>, regarding my dispute of the Barclays View Mastercard account XXXX in XXXX. 

I am writing to reiterate my position that the account was opened illegally while I was under the age of XXXX without a cosigner and without the means to independently make payments. 

According to the Credit Card Accountability Responsibility and Disclosure Act ( CARD Act ) and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidelines, specific requirements must be met when issuing a credit card to individuals under the age of XXXX. The CARD Act mandates that individuals under the age of XXXX must either demonstrate an independent source of funds sufficient to repay any debts incurred with the credit card or have a parent or another person who is at least XXXX XXXX XXXX cosign the credit card. Here is a direct reference to the policy for your convenience : The CARD Act requires people under age XXXX to have a parent or other person who is at least XXXX XXXX XXXX cosign the credit card if they cant demonstrate an independent source of funds sufficient to repay any debts incurred with the credit card. 

At the time this account was opened, I was under the age of XXXX and did not have a cosigner nor the means to independently make payments, which clearly violates both the CARD Act and CFPB regulations. Therefore, the account should never have been approved, and its presence on my credit report is erroneous and damaging. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your swift resolution of this issue. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Enclosures : - Previous Correspondence Copy of Identification

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I was informed by XXXX XXXX via chat that my Synchrony XXXX XXXX account was closed without my request or approval on XX/XX/XXXX. I was told that I would receive a letter in the mail stating the reason. Unfortunately, I did not receive this letter. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I called and was transferred to XXXX XXXX ( ID XXXX ). He was polite, patient and made a sincere effort to understand my situation and find a means to address it. He first saw to it that I would gain access to a digital copy of the letter dated XX/XX/XXXX. He also submitted a message to your back office to reevaluate my account. He did mention that the decision was made based on credit bureau reporting, payment history and buy patterns. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I gained access to the digital copy of the letter dated XX/XX/XXXX. It stated the reason for the decision to close my account as XXXX and unusual purchase history on your credit account that Synchrony deems XXXX be indicative of future intention not to pay. 

As a response to my XX/XX/XXXX call and the associated message submitted to the back office by XXXX XXXX, I received a physical letter [ Proc ID : XXXX ] dated XX/XX/XXXX from Synchrony Bank Customer Service Department. The letter confirmed that the closure was due to unusual payment or purchase activities on an account... 

My Synchrony XXXX XXXX credit card account was opened back on XX/XX/XXXX. Over the course of this accounts history, I have on several occasions generated similar payment and purchase activities without any actions taken by or communication provided by Synchrony. These purchases were approved, my payments toward these purchases were processed and my credit limit was restored without issue. Furthermore, I have never made a late payment during the entire history of my Synchrony XXXX XXXX or for any other credit card, loan or payment plan over the entirety of my credit report history. All of my credit reports are free of late payments, unpaid debts or collections since inception. 

If Synchrony Banks concern was of my potential intention not to pay, Synchrony could have elected to drastically reduce my credit limit to a modest sum to effectively address a perceived credit risk, all the while maintaining my account as active. 

According to the XX/XX/XXXX statement, XXXX Reward Points were earned during the last cycle on XXXX spend and XXXX Reward Points were pending from the previous cycle. 

Given the abrupt and blunt action taken by Synchrony Bank, I can not help but consider that I have been taken advantage of. Just as I had accrued a total of XXXX XXXX Rewards Points ( equivalent to {$2400.00} in purchases on XXXX ) and were soon to be credited, my account was closed.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.complaint_what_happened:
Bank of America has been entirely unhelpful and uncooperative in assisting me with recovering fraudulent charges made on my credit card. On the early morning of XX/XX/XXXX, my Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX left my possession and I did not notice. As a frequent XXXX XXXX user, I spent the rest of the day using that credit card from my phone and did not open my wallet ; therefore I did not realize my card was missing. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, at around XXXX XXXX, I looked at my credit card account and the recent charges on it and saw that there were XXXX fraudulent purchases totaling {$960.00} that occurred in the XXXX XXXX area of XXXX primarily on XX/XX/XXXX. I spent that entire day in XXXX. Once I realized my card was stolen, I immediately called Bank of America to lock my card and report the charges as fraud. I spoke to the first customer representative where I went through the nine charges that were fraud. I was told that a fraud specialist would need to handle the fraud claim since there were multiple fraudulent transactions ; I was transferred to the fraud department. In the middle of the transfer, the call hung up. I called back again and spoke with a different representative where I once again went through the fraud transactions, despite telling them that I was told a fraud specialist would need to handle the claim. After going through the transactions again, she confirmed my position and transferred my call. A fraud department representative answered and I then went through the nine separate transactions for a third time. I was told that my claim was successfully submitted. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an update about my claim that stated they were unable to pay it. The document stated that " We made this decision because : The merchant provided documentation confirming you received the merchandise or service. '' Following this I called back Bank of America to dispute this. On the call I learned that an incorrect, non-fraudulent purchase that I never at any point claimed to be fraud was included on the claim. I asked for that purchase to be removed from the claim. I also asked for the documentation provided by the merchant that confirmed I received the goods or service, but no document was found or sent to me. The claim was resubmitted. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received another update that again said they could not pay the claim. This document provided a list of the fraudulent transactions, and it STILL contained the non-fraud transaction that I asked to be removed. I called Bank of America once again and asked for the transaction to be remove from the account. During this interaction, the representative also informed me that the claim type filed was incorrect and was not accurate if I had lost the physical card. The claim was resubmitted. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the claim was once again denied. Again, the document stated that " We made this decision because : The merchant provided documentation confirming you received the merchandise or service. '' When asked for the documentation or other information used to come to this decision, none could be provided to me. I called and asked for the claim to be resubmitted. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the claim was denied again. Additionally, this document once again had the incorrect, non-fraudulent purchase on the claim. The document stated that " We made this decision because : The merchant provided documentation confirming you received the merchandise or service. '' This documentation or other information was not provided to me. I called and asked for the claim to be resubmitted. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the claim was denied once again. The document again stated that " We made this decision because : The merchant provided documentation confirming you received the merchandise or service. '' This documentation or other information was not provided to me. I called the representative within the fraud department and was told that this decision was made because : 1 ) I had used XXXX to use the card to pay for purchase while the fraud was occurring 2 ) I had opened my bank app on XX/XX/XXXX during the fraud events, but had not called to report fraud at the time. My rationale and defense for this is : I did not open my wallet the entire day I was using XXXX where I would have noticed the card to be missing. Additionally, when I open my bank app, the first accounts I see are for my checking and savings account. To see the charges for my credit card, I would have to deliberately scroll to the bottom on the page and then click on the account to see the charge details. I had used the app to XXXX someone via my checking account ; therefore I would not have seen the fraudulent purchases. I also did not receive proof that I had looked at the detailed credit charges of my account when the fraudulent purchases would have been present. I asked for the claim to be re-submitted. 

As a Bank of America XXXX since XXXX, I am extremely disappointed with this customer service and assistance with this issue. I have spent hours dealing with this and speaking to Bank of America employees, yet I still have not received a satisfactory resolution. I have not been asked to provide, at any point, any supporting evidence or documentation that confirms I did not make these purchases. Time and time again, I asked for the evidence that Bank of America is using to come to the determination that fraud did not occur and have not received anything. I believe that the initial issues associated with the claim ( incorrect non-fraudulent transaction and incorrect claim type ), are actively hurting resubmissions of the claim to this day, despite being problems that were not my fault. While the representatives that I have spoken with have been kind, a small handful have actually been helpful and some I believe have hurt my claim. I have filed a report to the police department to investigate this fraud and am attaching a photo of the initial intake form. I am working to get the full police report.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.sub_issue: Credit card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase on your statement

_source.complaint_what_happened:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a service called XXXX XXXX for a monthly fee of {$49.00}. 
I turned auto renewal off. 

The charge : on XX/XX/XXXX, the account was renewed at {$49.00}. The charge I am attempting to dispute is the XX/XX/XXXX charge. The charge went through XXXX XXXX 's payment processor XXXX XXXX XXXX. I attempted to contact both XXXX XXXX  and XXXX. XXXX XXXX  did not respond to communication attempts. XXXX  stated that it was XXXX XXXX 's problem and would not assist despite the charge being to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

The issue with Citi ( chief complaint ) I started a dispute with Citi around the unauthorized charge. At no point did Citi reach out for comment or accept any documentation about the unauthorized charge. After about 4 weeks, Citi closed the dispute. At no point did Citi ask for any supporting documentation. Citi did not provide a way to appeal the dispute. 

I attempted to contact customer support. Customer support said they would not be able to assist me and directed me to their " fruad department '' at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. However, when attempting to reach out to this number it rings and eventually I get a line disconnected message. 

Citi does not appear to be doing their diligence around helping me with an unauthorized charge and is not providing ways for me to be able to contact them for help.

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I have a CC with an ultra high limit that had not been used in years. One day I made a purchase at the gas station to fill up before a journey across the USA. An hour later I received text messages telling me my account was over the limit. 

I immediately looked at my banking records and confirmed that my card had been skimmed at the gas station based on all the charges all over the place. I immediately called USAA to haltcard and dispute charges. 

Fast forward 2 weeks I get notice from XXXX that my USAA card was over the limit. I immediately called USAA again to ask what is happening : 1. USAA did not put a security hold on my card from 2 weeks earlier as it should have done 2. USAA had made no progress investigating the skimmed card and disputed charges. They claimed not to have a record. 
3. Only after this follow up call 2 weeks later did USAA cancel and block the card. 
3. Now my credit ratio is being dinged and USAA is expecting me to pay for a card that was stolen/skimmed, and used by criminals to exceed the credit limit.
_source.issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card

_source.sub_issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card

_source.complaint_what_happened: I received an email from Aspire Credit Card Company they were raising my monthly maintenance fee to XXXX and my interest rate to 31 % if i disagreed to call them. I called and told them no on the increase in maintenance fee. On XX/XX/XXXX. They transferred me to a woman who said if you dont accept the terms we will close your account right now. I said then close it. She read me a disclosure and stated your card is closed and do not use it and cut it up. I agreed. I then followed up on the XXXX of XXXX to ensure it was closed. And found it still open. So i asked again to close the card. She said it takes 10 days but would be closed soon. I then called on XXXX of XX/XX/year> and card was still open and was told it would take another 45 days to close. I want the card closed immediately. Furthermore i found they have been charging me XXXX for credit card protection i never ordered and wont stop charging it. My credit card number is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX under XXXX XXXX

_source.complaint_what_happened:
I initially was provided with a credit card through Bank of America. I transferred a balance from another higher interest card. After I did that Bank of America reduced my credit limit multiple times even though all payments were made timely through auto-withdrawal. One payment was delayed for a few days because I had to close a checking account and reopen another due to fraud. 

Every time they reduce the credit limit it negatively impacts my credit report and credit score. This should not be legal if a consumer has paid timely with no issue with the company. 

The company basically is providing misleading information. I have spoken to the company and they indicated that the only thing I could do was to request that my credit limit be increased back to what it was and they may or may not grant it.

I would ask that my credit limit be increased back to what was originally provided so that it does not negatively indicate my credit report by reducing my available credit. I feel that I was taken advantage of by utilizing bait and switch by providing a certain credit limit. I would not have switched companies if I had known they were going to do this and would subsequent negatively impact my credit.
_source.sub_product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
